main event: A civilian observed a low-flying balloon-like object over Hampton, Virginia on January 28, 1965.
interesting points: The object was described as being bright orange or red with an aluminum color., The object hovered and drifted slowly to the west for 10 seconds., The observer used binoculars to see the object, which made no discernible sound., The object was reported to have been at a high altitude, first seen slightly northwest of the observer's position., The sighting coincided with the launch of a balloon from the Norfolk Weather Bureau shortly before the observation.
sighted object: one balloon-like object in the sky
witness description: Mrs. [REDACTED], a civilian housewife from Hampton, Virginia
